input: What does Section 74 of the IPC define?
target: Section 74 limits solitary confinement to no more than 14 consecutive days and requires intervals between subsequent periods.

input: Does Section 74 apply to all sentences?
target: No, Section 74 applies only when solitary confinement is part of the punishment.

input: What is the purpose of Section 74?
target: Section 74 aims to prevent the excessive use of solitary confinement by ensuring breaks in its application.

input: Can solitary confinement exceed 14 days without intervals under Section 74?
target: No, solitary confinement must be spaced out with intervals if it exceeds 14 days.

input: What is an example of Section 74 in action?
target: A convict sentenced to 30 days of solitary confinement must have intervals after every 14 days.
